comment: If its on a Flash drive, more than likely, it is not an authorized copy of the security information. It is more likely the data was stolen using a flash drive to be delivered to bad people. If that's the case, We are actually lucky the perps lost it.
amr:
# ::snt If its on a Flash drive, more than likely, it is not an authorized copy of the security information. It is more likely the data was stolen using a flash drive to be delivered to bad people. If that's the case, We are actually lucky the perps lost it.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (l / likely-01
            :ARG1 (c / copy-01
                  :polarity -
                  :ARG1 (ii / information
                        :mod (s / security))
                  :ARG1-of (a / authorize-01))
            :condition (b / be-located-at-91
                  :ARG1 (ii2 / it)
                  :ARG2 (d / drive
                        :mod (f / flash)))
            :ARG2-of (h / have-degree-91
                  :ARG1 c
                  :ARG3 (m2 / more)))
      :snt2 (l2 / likely-01
            :ARG1 (s2 / steal-01
                  :ARG1 (d2 / data)
                  :manner (u / use-01
                        :ARG1 (d3 / drive
                              :mod (f2 / flash))
                        :ARG2 (d4 / deliver-01
                              :ARG1 d2
                              :ARG2 (p / person
                                    :ARG1-of (b2 / bad-07)))))
            :ARG2-of (h2 / have-degree-91
                  :ARG1 s2
                  :ARG3 (m3 / more)))
      :snt3 (l3 / lucky
            :domain (w / we)
            :ARG1-of (a2 / actual-02)
            :condition (l4 / lose-02
                  :ARG0 (p2 / perp)
                  :ARG1 (ii3 / it))))
